title: Drawing, ca. 1790
medium: Pencil.  Pen; Chinese ink.  Sepia wash.
provenance: From the collection of  Léon Decloux.  Enterd his coll. after 1906.  Possibly from the Hippolyte Destailleur coll., fro Decloux says of it: “le dessin attribute à Delafosse par Monsieur Destailleur, ne me semble pas de ce maitre; il est certainement d’un des grands orfèvre du XVIIIe siècle.  Destailleur sale, Paris, 19 May 1896, no. 108 (reprod.)
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: The foot is decorated with beads and festoons.  A satyr couple seated on pilaster strips support the socket in which a burning candle sticks.  Reverse; horizontally.  A caryatid supporting an entablature; plans; scribbling; pencil.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, ca. 1790.
ca. 1790. Pencil.  Pen; Chinese ink.  Sepia wash.. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-69.
